channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned car, 11th June
item.description:
Car has been in the same spot for over 2 years. Police came today to removed the cloned number plates and told residents that the council need to remove it from the highway. Its a grey Vauxhall parked near number 22 blake close.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blake Close, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous blind spot, 11th June
item.description:
Pedestrians walking from Crossfors Street cannot view incoming vehicles from around the corner Eastcote Street and Lingham Street which often speed: likewise vehicles from lingham street approaching Crossford and Eastcote cannot view incoming vehicles, it's a blind spot

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crossford Street, Stockwell, London

item.title: Low hanging branches, 11th June
item.description:
On the west side of the roundabout, the branches from the trees are down to about 1.5 m above the footpath and cycle path. They could do with at least 1 m cutting off.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Merbury Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public littering in a private property, 11th June
item.description:
Sadly, people fail to realise this front porch is a private home, the public think it's okay to fly tip leaving their bulky waste collection on my wall. They continue to throw rubbish over the wall into my front porch. Utterly disgraceful behaviour.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Zenoria Street, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drains blocked leading to sewage backflow into propert, 11th June
item.description:
Drains that lead from flats into the main sewage run but thames water is blocked. This has cause reverse flow into toilet downstairs of properties and poor drainage in sinks and toilets as well as route for rats into property,
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pitfield Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large bush on pavemnt forcing people into road to pass, 11th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolbrook Road, Crayford, London
